headline.main: RADON POLLUTION MAY BE THE COUNTRY'S MOST FAR-REACHING ENVIRONMENTAL HAZARD

byline.original: By JOHN H. DORSEY; Senator John H. Dorsey, Republican of the 25th District (parts of Morris County), is the assistant minority leader of the State Senate

docs.lead_paragraph: WHEN Stanley Watras walked through the radiation monitors at a Limerick, Pa., nuclear-power plant last year, he sounded an alarm across the country. Stanley Watras wasn't exposed to radiation at the plant. It was in his home. In fact, he and his wife and two children were exposed to such dangerous levels of radon in their home that the risk was equivalent to smoking 135 packs of cigarettes a day.
